He became a U.S. citizen and served in the Navy. He witnessed two nuclear tests in the Pacific, exposing him to several lifetimes' worth of radiation.

He married my mother, Shirley, and became an IBEW lineman. They raised a family.

He served on the school board and volunteered in our small town. He owned his own home.

That’s a long way of saying my dad lived the American Dream. 

That’s the America that taught me what it means to love this country.
